definition: day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
night

sentences.english: I don't want to work day and night, I just want to be a campus drifter.
sentences.chinese: 我不想沒日沒夜地工作，只想做個校漂族。

sentences.english: Consoling a colicky baby night after night is terribly hard.
sentences.chinese: 沒日沒夜的照顧小鬧騰非常的辛苦。

sentences.english: Stayin up for days in the chelsea hotel.
sentences.chinese: 在切爾西飯店沒日沒夜的那幾天。

sentences.english: Stayin' up for days in the Chelsea Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 在切爾西飯店沒日沒夜的這些天裏。

sentences.english: YouBin care day and night, she recognised.
sentences.chinese: 尤斌沒日沒夜悉心照顧，得到周母認可。

sentences.english: The noise produced by cars day and night disturbs people's daily life.
sentences.chinese: 私家車沒日沒夜地製造噪音干擾人們的生活。

sentences.english: The telex chattered all day and night with news bulletins.
sentences.chinese: 電傳機沒日沒夜“嗒嗒嗒”地接收新聞稿。

sentences.english: Sunset night thoughts, has turned to be missed.
sentences.chinese: 沒日沒夜的，已變成懷念。

sentences.english: First they chatted on Net, days and nights.
sentences.chinese: 先只是聊天，沒日沒夜地聊。

sentences.english: Without anything to do, he played computer games all day.
sentences.chinese: 無所事事，他只能打遊戲，沒日沒夜。

sentences.english: A whole have their own like a gyroscope, around the day and night.
sentences.chinese: 一個個都把自己整得像個陀螺，沒日沒夜的轉悠。

sentences.english: They are still working twenty-four seven!
sentences.chinese: 他們還是沒日沒夜的工作。

definition: overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to work hard
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to be unable to breathe
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
unhurried/calm/composed/leisurely
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
in full swing (idiom)/(in a) frenzy/buzzing with activity
to remain unmoved
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
